title: File System Operations in Shell
description: In this lab, you will learn how to perform various file tests in the shell. You'll create test files and directories, check for their existence, and test file permissions. By the end of this lab, you'll be able to write shell scripts that can interact with the file system and make decisions based on file properties.

meta.title: Shell Scripting: Mastering File System Operations and Tests
meta.description: Learn to perform file system operations and tests in shell scripting. Create files and directories, check for their existence, and test file permissions using bash commands.
meta.keywords: shell scripting, file tests, bash, file existence, file permissions, directory operations, shell commands, file system

verify.name: Verify test file creation and content
verify.hint: Make sure you have created the file test_file.txt and it contains the phrase "test file". You can create it using: echo "This is a test file for our lab." > test_file.txt

verify.name: Verify file_exists.sh script
verify.hint: Ensure that file_exists.sh exists and contains the line setting the filename variable. You can create it using touch file_exists.sh

verify.name: Verify dir_exists.sh script and directory creation
verify.hint: Make sure you have created both the dir_exists.sh script and the test_directory. You can create the directory using: mkdir test_directory

verify.name: Verify file_readable.sh script and file permissions
verify.hint: Ensure that file_readable.sh exists and test_file.txt has read permissions. You can add read permissions using: chmod +r test_file.txt
